title: hihai explorer
text: Imagine going hospital treatment end leaving another infection. Healthcare-associated infections (HAIs) major health burden Germany, affecting approximately 1 25 hospitalised patients. infections cause significant illness, deaths, health costs every year. hihai package provides clean datasets interactive Shiny app explore, visualise, interpret burden HAIs Germany using data 2011 ECDC Point Prevalence Survey.

title: hihai explorer
text: end guide, ’ll able : Load explore HAI datasets Understand key metrics Use interactive Shiny app analyse HAIs Compare Germany’s burden EU/EEA countries Analyse infections cause harm suggest recommendation tackle problems

title: hihai explorer
text: package uses two cleaned datasets: hai_data: German PPS (46 German hospitals 9,626 patients) 95% uncertainty interval (UI). hai_comparison: Germany vs EU/EEA rates using ECDC PPS (1,149 hospitals 273,753 patients) 95% uncertainty interval (UI).

title: hihai explorer
text: hai_type: abbreviation 5 HAI types hai_name: name 5 HAI types cases: Annual number infections deaths: Attributable mortality dalys: Disability-adjusted life years (YLL + YLD) yll: Years life lost yld: Years lived disability estimates include lower upper bound 95% UI Exploring Germany’s HAI burden: international comparison:

title: hihai explorer
text: Install hihai Github: Load package: application contains 3 main tabs; explore, severity, comparison. Explore view: Examine HAI frequency customisable metrics Severity view: Visualise relationship frequency impact Comparison view: Contrast German rates EU/EEA averages Launch Shiny app:

title: hihai explorer
text: Question answered: common HAI type impact ?

title: hihai explorer
text: tab focuses solely Germany (German PPS data). Bar chart shows frequency HAIs selected metric (cases, deaths, DALYs) HAI type descending order.

title: hihai explorer
text: Metric dropdown: Cases: many infections occurred Deaths: many people died HAIs DALYS: Overall health burden YLLs: Years life lost YLDs: Years lived disability Check box Check/uncheck filter specific infections Useful comparing side--side data 95% UI toggle Shows error bars statistical uncertainty Lower upper bound true value likely falls

title: hihai explorer
text: Figure1. Bar chart illustrate frequency HAIs X-axis: HAI types (UTI, HAP, SSI, CDI, BSI) Y-axis: Changes based selected metric Bar height: Value metric Error bars: 95% Uncertainty interval Colors: HAI type distinct color

title: hihai explorer
text: Table shows actual number cases, deaths, DALYs, YLLs, YLDs. can sort clicking column headers (Descending Ascending).

title: hihai explorer
text: bottom, app automatically generates ranking summary. Example: look cases: total = 476,936 cases.  1st rank Urinary Tract Infection (UTI) 214,150 cases, accounting 44.9% total infections. summary updates based selected metric, making easy capture findings. learn: UTI common type HAI, HAP causes harm overall.

title: hihai explorer
text: Question answered: infections deadly relative common ? Frequency alone doesn’t tell full story. understand impact, package combine cases, deaths, DALYs using bubble chart.

title: hihai explorer
text: Bubble chart reveals relationship : Frequency (common) Mortality (deadly) Burden (overall impact)

what: How to read the bubble chart
title: hihai explorer
text: Figure2. Bubble chart demonstrate severity HAIs X-axis: Annual number cases (right => common) Y-axis: Annual attributable deaths (Higher => deadly) Bubble size: DALYs (bigger bubble = higher overall burden) Color: HAI type distinct color Label: Abbreviation HAI type (UTI, HAP, SSI, CDI, BSI)

title: hihai explorer
text: Hover bubble see detailed statistics: Example tooltip:

title: hihai explorer
text: Upper Right (e.g., UTI) Many cases (far right) Moderate deaths (middle height) Large bubble (high total burden due volume) Upper left (e.g., BSI HAP) Fewer cases (left side) High deaths (high ) Large bubble (high burden despite lower frequency)

title: hihai explorer
text: Frequency alone misleading, BSI 26,976 cases 3,905 deaths UTI 214,150 cases 3,664 deaths. learn: Despite fewer cases, BSI causes similar total deaths.

title: hihai explorer
text: Question answered: Germany’s HAI burden perform comparing European countries?

title: hihai explorer
text: side--side bar chart comparing: Red bars: Germany (German PPS) Blue bars: EU/EEA Average (ECDC PPS)

title: hihai explorer
text: Metric dropdown: Cases: many infections occurred Deaths: many people died HAIs DALYS: Overall health burden Population scale slider: Adjust 1,000 100,000 Changes “per X population” calculation Default: 100,000 population

title: hihai explorer
text: Figure3. Clustered bar chart compare Germany European countries X-axis: HAI types (UTI, HAP, SSI, CDI, BSI) Y-axis: Rates per 100,000 population (adjust according slider) Error bars: 95% Uncertainty interval

title: hihai explorer
text: chart, app automatically generates automatic interpretation compares HAI type based metric choose. learn: Germany shows higher burden across metrics, despite good hospital infection protocol. Reasons include high hospitalisation rates large bed capacity, create exposure opportunities.
code: Example: When we look at (100,000 population),  Comparing German PPS to EU/EEA rates for DALYs: - CDI: Germany 159% higher (25.9 vs 10) - UTI: Germany 45% higher (82.6 vs 57.1) - HAP: Germany 22% lower (86.1 vs 109.8) - BSI: similar rates (Germany: 72.2 vs EU/EEA: 76.2) - SSI: similar rates (Germany: 35.7 vs EU/EEA: 35.1)*

what: Q1: Why sometimes the number is not exactly match?
title: hihai explorer
text: Ans: row calculated independently using Monte Carlo simulations. Due rounding UI, may result differ sum individual HAI types.

title: hihai explorer
text: Ans: uncertainty interval confidently 95% true value lies within range.

what: Q3: Which metric should I use?
title: hihai explorer
text: Ans:

title: hihai explorer
text: HAI major health burden Germany causes 478,000 cases, 16,000 deaths 249,000 DALYs year.

title: hihai explorer
text: UTI common type HAI contributing 45% total cases causes moderate severity human. Meanwhile HAP BSI less common roughly 22% 6% overall frequency causes 51% total mortality.

title: hihai explorer
text: Germany higher population burden EU/EEA average. Due high hospitalisation rates bed capacity accelerate exposure overall.

title: hihai explorer
text: According , 20-30% HAIs preventable better hygiene, infection control, shorter hospital stays. Prevention strategies prioritise infections cause greatest harm, just frequent one.

title: hihai explorer
text: package interactive Shiny application developed part ETC5523 assignment. Package development, documentation, pkgdown site creation supported R ecosystem: usethis, devtools, roxygen2 package setup documentation pkgdown website structure deployment Shiny application uses: shiny shinythemes UI layout CSS custom styling ggplot2 visualisations plotly interactive plots DT interactive data tables dplyr tidyr data wrangling scales number formatting LICENSING package released MIT License. free reuse modify code package terms LICENSE file included repository. Data provided non-commercial educational use. original data sources remain property European Centre Disease Prevention Control (ECDC). underlying data originates 2011 ECDC Point Prevalence Survey (European Centre Disease Prevention Control based BHAI approach Zacher et al. (2019) visualisation, transformation, interpretation package written author.

title: hihai explorer
text: Zacher, B., Haller, S., Willrich, N., Walter, J., Sin, M. ., Cassini, ., Plachouras, D., Suetens, C., Behnke, M., Gastmeier, P., Wieler, L. H., & Eckmanns, T. (2019). Application new methodology R package reveals high burden healthcare-associated infections (HAI) Germany compared average European Union/European Economic Area, 2011 2012. Eurosurveillance, 24(46). https://doi.org/10.2807/1560-7917.es.2019.24.46.1900135

title: Healthcare-Associated Infections Data Explorer with Shiny
text: hihai package transforms heathcare data interactive tools. provides two tidy datasets Shiny app explore burden Healthcare-Associated Infections (HAIs) Germany compared EU/EEA countries.

title: Healthcare-Associated Infections Data Explorer with Shiny
text: data based BHAI package collected 2011 ECDC Point Prevalence Survey covering 46 German hospitals (9,626 patients) 29 EU/EEA countries (273,753 patients). Hihai makes easy : Explore HAI burden across five infection types • HAP - Health-Associated Pneumonia • SSI - Surgical Site Infection • BSI - Bloodstream Infection • UTI - Urinary Tract Infection • CDI - Clostridioides difficile Infection Analyse frequency vs severity identify high-impact infections Compare Germany’s performance EU/EEA countries Visualise trends interactive charts

title: Healthcare-Associated Infections Data Explorer with Shiny
text: can install development version :

title: Healthcare-Associated Infections Data Explorer with Shiny
text: Shiny app features: Getting started : Introduction field explanations Explore : Bar chart comparing HAIs different metrics Severity : Bubble chart showing severity Comparison : Germany vs EU/EEA clustered chart

what: Germany vs EU/EEA HAI Comparison — hai_comparison
title: Germany vs EU/EEA HAI Comparison — hai_comparison
text: dataset contains per 100000 population rates HAIs, deaths DALYs, comparing German PPS, German Convenience, ECDC PPS (EU/EEA) estimates.

title: Germany vs EU/EEA HAI Comparison — hai_comparison
Germany vs EU/EEA HAI Comparison — hai_comparison
text: tibble 18 rows (5 HAI types × 3 sample set) 13 columns. hai_type Abbreviated infection type — UTI, HAP, SSI, CDI, BSI, . hai_name Full descriptive infection name. sample Sample type ("German PPS", "German Convenience", "ECDC PPS (EU/EEA)"). cases_100k, deaths_100k, dalys_100k Rates per 100,000 population. cases_lower, cases_upper Lower / upper 95% uncertainty intervals cases. deaths_lower, deaths_upper Lower / upper 95% uncertainty intervals deaths. dalys_lower, dalys_upper Lower / upper 95% uncertainty intervals DALYs.

title: Germany vs EU/EEA HAI Comparison — hai_comparison

what: Healthcare-Associated Infections in Germany (2011 PPS) — hai_data
title: Healthcare-Associated Infections in Germany (2011 PPS) — hai_data
text: dataset provides estimated annual numbers healthcare-associated infections (HAIs) Germany based 2011 ECDC Point Prevalence Survey.

title: Healthcare-Associated Infections in Germany (2011 PPS) — hai_data
Healthcare-Associated Infections in Germany (2011 PPS) — hai_data
text: tibble 6 rows (5 infection types + "") 18 columns: hai_type Abbreviated infection type — UTI, HAP, SSI, CDI, BSI, . hai_name Full descriptive infection name. sample Survey type ("PPS"). cases, deaths, dalys, yll, yld Annual estimated. cases_lower, cases_upper Lower / upper 95% uncertainty intervals cases. deaths_lower, deaths_upper Lower / upper 95% uncertainty intervals deaths. dalys_lower, dalys_upper Lower / upper 95% uncertainty intervals DALYs. yll_lower, yll_upper Lower / upper 95% uncertainty intervals YLLs. yld_lower, yld_upper Lower / upper 95% uncertainty intervals YLDs.
